children.subject: Something I’ve seen people do in the past is ask the professor who advises the PhD student they work with to write a letter, and have the PhD student provide them with information / context / details (sometimes the PhD student even writes most of the letter). Most professors seem to be willing to do this, and this will probably be a much bigger asset to your application than a letter from a professor that just says “they got a good grade in my class”.

history.content: I am currently applying for research opportunities next summer. There are several good programs but they all require recommendation letters (some programs require the letters must be from professors). I have done some research with PhD students, but not faculty members. What are the common policies for professors to write recommendation letters? I have completed some relevant coursework and got very good grades, but I do not have close contact with faculty members. Any advice for getting these letters?
history.subject: Getting recommendation letters for REU Applications
